alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:12AM MDT until April 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Snake Creek near Ashton affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake Creek near Ashton. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 1 mile east of the gauge and the bridge 1 mile northwest of the gauge At 15.5 feet, The bridges 1 mile east and 1 mile northwest of the gauge are both overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Wednesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon and continue falling to 8.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 715 PM CDT.
